hmPlatform4Routing.name: hmPlatform4Routing
hmPlatform4Routing.contactinfo: Customer Support Postal: Hirschmann Automation and Control GmbH Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Tel: +49 7127 14 1981 Web: http://www.hicomcenter.com/ E-Mail: hicomcenter@hirschmann.com
hmPlatform4Routing.description: The Hirschmann Private Platform4 Routing MIB definitions for Platform devices.

hmAgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.name: hmAgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime
hmAgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.description: Configures the ARP entry ageout time in seconds. Allowable range: 15-21600

hmAgentSwitchArpResponseTime.name: hmAgentSwitchArpResponseTime
hmAgentSwitchArpResponseTime.description: Configures the ARP request response timeout in seconds. Allowable range: 1-10

hmAgentSwitchArpMaxRetries.name: hmAgentSwitchArpMaxRetries
hmAgentSwitchArpMaxRetries.description: Configures the ARP count of maximum request for retries. Allowable range: 0-10

hmAgentSwitchArpCacheSize.name: hmAgentSwitchArpCacheSize
hmAgentSwitchArpCacheSize.description: Configures the ARP maximum number of entries in the cache. Allowable range is platform-specific.

hmAgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.name: hmAgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew
hmAgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.description: This indicates the current setting of ARP dynamic renew mode.

hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.name: hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent
hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of entries in the ARP cache.

hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.name: hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak
hmAgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.description: Peak number of entries recorded in the ARP cache over time. This value is restarted whenever the ARP cache size is changed.

hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.name: hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent
hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of configured static ARP entries.

hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.name: hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax
hmAgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.description: Maximum number of configurable static ARP entries.

hmAgentSwitchArpTable.name: hmAgentSwitchArpTable
hmAgentSwitchArpTable.description: This table augments the MIB-II ipNetToMediaTable by providing per-interface ARP entry information.

hmAgentSwitchArpAge.name: hmAgentSwitchArpAge
hmAgentSwitchArpAge.description: This defines the time (in seconds) since the ARP entry was last refreshed. This value is 0 for ARP entries of type local(1) or static(3), since these entries are not subject to aging.

hmAgentSwitchArpIpAddress.name: hmAgentSwitchArpIpAddress
hmAgentSwitchArpIpAddress.description: The IP Address assigned to each interface.

hmAgentSwitchArpMacAddress.name: hmAgentSwitchArpMacAddress
hmAgentSwitchArpMacAddress.description: The hardware MAX Address that each interface maps to.

hmAgentSwitchArpInterface.name: hmAgentSwitchArpInterface
hmAgentSwitchArpInterface.description: The Associated IfIndex which identified the ARP Entry.

hmAgentSwitchArpStatus.name: hmAgentSwitchArpStatus
hmAgentSwitchArpStatus.description: The status of this ARP entry. Setting this object destroy will remove the entry.

hmAgentSwitchArpSparseLearn.name: hmAgentSwitchArpSparseLearn
hmAgentSwitchArpSparseLearn.description: This indicates the current setting of ARP sparse learn mode.

hmAgentSwitchIpRoutingMode.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRoutingMode
hmAgentSwitchIpRoutingMode.description: Administratively enables/disables routing on the switch.

hmAgentSwitchIpVRRPMode.name: hmAgentSwitchIpVRRPMode
hmAgentSwitchIpVRRPMode.description: Administratively enables/disables VRRP on the switch.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this instance.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.description: The IpAddress assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask must be set at the same time.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.description: The NetMask assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress must be set at the same time.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.description: Sets the interface's primary IpAddress and NetMask back to 0.0.0.0. The primary ip address can be removed if and only if there are no configured secondary addresses.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.description: Enables or disables routing for this interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode.description: Enables or disables Proxy ARP for this interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue.description: Configures the MTU value for this interface. If the value returned is 0 this interface is not enabled for routing. It is not valid to set this value to 0 if routing is enabled.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceSlotNum.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceSlotNum
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceSlotNum.description: The Slot Number associated with this instance.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfacePortNum.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfacePortNum
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfacePortNum.description: The Port Number associated with this instance.

hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMod.name: hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMode
hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMod.description: Enables or disables netdirected broadcasts for this interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.description: There is no global administrative flag for router discovery. The global routing flag (hmAgentSwitchIpRoutingMode) will be used for this purpose. If routing is disabled, router discovery is disabled as well.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.description: Interface Number to configure Router Discovery on.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseM.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseMode
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseM.description: Enable or disable router discovery on the interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdverti.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdverti.description: Maximum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdverti.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvertisementInterval
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdverti.description: Minimum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface. This value must be less than or equal to hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisem.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementLifetime
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisem.description: Value of lifetime field of router advertsisement sent from the interface. This value must be greater than or equal to hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreference.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenceLevel
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreference.description: Preferability of the address as a default router address, related to other addresses on the same subnet. This is defined as the larger the number, the higher the preference.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisem.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementAddress
hmAgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisem.description: Address used when sending router advertisements from the interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpVlanEntry.name: hmAgentSwitchIpVlanEntry
hmAgentSwitchIpVlanEntry.description: A Static VLAN for which routing can be enabled/disabled.

hmAgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.name: hmAgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex
hmAgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this VLAN.

hmAgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.name: hmAgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus
hmAgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.description: Status of Routing mode per Vlan. active(1) - Vlan is enabled for routing createAndGo(4) - Adds Vlan entry for routing destroy(6) - Removes Vlan from routing

hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable.name: hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable
hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable.description: Contains a list of secondary IP Addresses associated with an interface.

hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry.name: hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry
hmAgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry.description: A secondary IP Address for a given interface. This IP Address must not conflict with the IP Address configured in the hmAgentSwitchIpInterfaceTable.

hmAgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress.name: hmAgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress
hmAgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress.description: The Secondary IP Address assigned to this interface.

hmAgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask.name: hmAgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask
hmAgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask.description: The Secondary Net Mask assigned to this interface. This value must be set during creation, and can not be changed.

hmAgentSwitchSecondaryStatus.name: hmAgentSwitchSecondaryStatus
hmAgentSwitchSecondaryStatus.description: Creates a new entry in the Secondary Address table. Allowed values are: createAndGo(4) - Creates an entry in this table, associating the address with a given interface. The hmAgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask object must be set during creation. destroy(6) - Removes the associated address from the interface.

hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceTable.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceTable
hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure the preferences/ administrative distances for the various routing protocols:

hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceSource.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceSource
hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceSource.description: Routing protocol for which this entry belongs

hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceValue.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceValue
hmAgentSwitchIpRoutePreferenceValue.description: Adminstrative distance for this routing protocol.

hmAgentSwitchIpRouteStaticTrackId.name: hmAgentSwitchIpRouteStaticTrackId
hmAgentSwitchIpRouteStaticTrackId.description: The trackId of the object that should be tracked by this nexthop. If the object goes down, the nexthop is removed from the routing table, it is added again if the object goes up. A value of zero means no tracking

hmAgentSwitchIpVlanSingleMacMode.name: hmAgentSwitchIpVlanSingleMacMode
hmAgentSwitchIpVlanSingleMacMode.description: If enabled, all vlan routing interfaces use the same MAC address.

hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeArp.name: hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeArp
hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeArp.description: Sets the maximum size of the ARP table for routing

hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeUCRoutes.name: hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeUCRoutes
hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeUCRoutes.description: Sets the size of the unicast route table

hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeMCRoutes.name: hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeMCRoutes
hmAgentSwitchIpTableSizeMCRoutes.description: Sets the size of the multicast route table

hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeArp.name: hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeArp
hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeArp.description: The current size of the ARP table for routing

hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeUCRoutes.name: hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeUCRoutes
hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeUCRoutes.description: The current size of the unicast route table

hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeMCRoutes.name: hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeMCRoutes
hmAgentSwitchIpCurrentTableSizeMCRoutes.description: The current size of the multicast route table

hmAgentRouterRipAdminState.name: hmAgentRouterRipAdminState
hmAgentRouterRipAdminState.description: Sets the administrative mode of RIP in the router.

hmAgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.name: hmAgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode
hmAgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.description: Sets the RIP split horizon operating mode in the router. A value of none(1) means split horizon processing is disabled. When set to simple(2), the simple split horizon technique is used. When set to poisonReverse(3), the split horizon with poison reverse technique is used. The default split horizon mode is simple(2).

hmAgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.name: hmAgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode
hmAgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.description: Sets the RIP auto summarization mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that routes advertized by this RIP router are combined, or summarized, whenever possible into aggregates. When set to disable(2), routes are not aggregated in RIP updates generated by this router. The default auto summary mode is enable(1).

hmAgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.name: hmAgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode
hmAgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.description: Sets the RIP host route acceptance mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that host routes advertized to this RIP router will be accepted (learned) into its routing table. When set to disable(2), host routes advertized in RIP updates from neighboring routers are ignored. The default host routes accept mode is enable(1).

hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetric.name: hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetric
hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when RIP redistributes from other protocols.

hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.name: hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured
hmAgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP default-metric is configured or not.

hmAgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.name: hmAgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate
hmAgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether RIP can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistTable.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistTable
hmAgentRipRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for RIP. Here, RIP is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, OSPF, Static, Connected.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistSource.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistSource
hmAgentRipRouteRedistSource.description: Source route, from which RIP can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the RIP redistribution Table entry.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMode.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMode
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMode.description: User enabels/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetric.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetric
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into RIP.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP redistribute-metric is configured or not.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF internal routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2
hmAgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistList.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistList
hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol.

hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.name: hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured
hmAgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

hmAgentRip2IfConfTable.name: hmAgentRip2IfConfTable
hmAgentRip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP. Augments rip2IfConfTable in the RIPv2-MIB.

hmAgentRip2IfConfEntry.name: hmAgentRip2IfConfEntry
hmAgentRip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet. Augments rip2IfConfEntry in RIPv2-MIB.

hmAgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.name: hmAgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId
hmAgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the RIPv2-MIB rip2IfConfAuthType is md5(3); otherwise, the value is not used.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceIfIndex.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceIfIndex
hmAgentRip2InterfaceIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this instance.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType
hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType.description: The type of Authentication used on this interface.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKey.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKey
hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKey.description: The value to be used as the Authentication Key whenever the corresponding instance of hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType has a value other than noAuthentication. A modification of the corresponding instance of hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType does not modify the hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKey value. If a string shorter than 16 octets is supplied, it will be left- justified and padded to 16 octets, on the right, with nulls (0x00). Reading this object always results in an OCTET STRING of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKeyId.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKeyId
hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the hmAgentRip2InterfaceAuthType is md5(3); otherwise, the value is not used.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceSendVersion.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceSendVersion
hmAgentRip2InterfaceSendVersion.description: What the router sends on this interface. ripVersion1 implies sending RIP updates compliant with RFC 1058. rip1Compatible implies broadcasting RIP-2 updates using RFC 1058 route subsumption rules. ripVersion2 implies multicasting RIP-2 updates.

hmAgentRip2InterfaceReceiveVersion.name: hmAgentRip2InterfaceReceiveVersion
hmAgentRip2InterfaceReceiveVersion.description: This indicates which version of RIP updates are to be accepted. Note that rip2 and rip1OrRip2 implies reception of multicast packets.

hmAgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval.name: hmAgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval
hmAgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval.description: Sets the RIP update timer interval in the router. This is the time in seconds between two full routing table update packets.

hmAgentOspfDefaultMetric.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultMetric
hmAgentOspfDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when OSPF redistributes from other protocols.

hmAgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured
hmAgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-metric is configured or not.

hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate
hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether OSPF can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways
hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.description: When this flag is true, the router advertises 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 always. Without this option, OSPF will only advertise 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 if the router's forwarding table contains a default route.

hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric
hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.description: Metric of the default route,which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol.

hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricCon.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricConfigured
hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricCon.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-info originate metric is configured or not.

hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricTyp.name: hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricType
hmAgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricTyp.description: Metric Type of the default route,which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTable.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTable
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for OSPF. Here, OSPF is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, RIP, Static, Connected.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSource.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSource
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSource.description: Source protocol, from which OSPF can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the OSPF redistribution Table entry.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMode.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMode
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMode.description: User enabels/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetric.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetric
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into OSPF.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF redistribute-metric is configured or not.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.description: Metric Type of routes,which OSPF redistributes from other source protocols. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTag.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTag
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistTag.description: It specifies the tag field in routes redistributed by OSPF.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.description: If this value is false, then OSPF will not redistribute subnetted routes.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistList.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistList
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol.

hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured.name: hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured
hmAgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

hmAgentOspfIfTable.name: hmAgentOspfIfTable
hmAgentOspfIfTable.description: The OSPF Interface Table describes the inter- faces from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

hmAgentOspfIfEntry.name: hmAgentOspfIfEntry
hmAgentOspfIfEntry.description: The OSPF Interface Entry describes one inter- face from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

hmAgentOspfIfAuthKeyId.name: hmAgentOspfIfAuthKeyId
hmAgentOspfIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

hmAgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag.name: hmAgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag
hmAgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag.description: Configures the IP MTU Ignore Flag value for this OSPF interface.

hmAgentOspfVirtIfTable.name: hmAgentOspfVirtIfTable
hmAgentOspfVirtIfTable.description: Information about this router's virtual inter- faces. Augments ospfVirtIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

hmAgentOspfVirtIfEntry.name: hmAgentOspfVirtIfEntry
hmAgentOspfVirtIfEntry.description: Information about a single Virtual Interface. Augments ospfVirtIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

hmAgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.name: hmAgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId
hmAgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this virtual interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfVirtIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

hmAgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMod.name: hmAgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMode
hmAgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMod.description: From RFC2328: Controls the preference rules used in Section 16.4 when choosing among multiple AS-external-LSAs advertising the same destination. When set to 'enabled', the preference rules remain those specified by RFC 1583 ([Ref9]). When set to 'disabled', the preference rules are those stated in Section 16.4.1, which prevent routing loops when AS- external-LSAs for the same destination have been originated from different areas. Set to 'enabled' by default. In order to minimize the chance of routing loops, all OSPF routers in an OSPF routing domain should have RFC1583Compatibility set identically. When there are routers present that have not been updated with the functionality specified in Section 16.4.1 of this memo, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'enabled'. Otherwise, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'disabled', preventing all routing loops.

hmAgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.name: hmAgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag
hmAgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP new master notification traps.

hmAgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.name: hmAgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag
hmAgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP authentication failure notification traps.

hmAgentECMPOspfMaxPaths.name: hmAgentECMPOspfMaxPaths
hmAgentECMPOspfMaxPaths.description: It sets the number of paths that OSPF can report for a given destination where maxpaths is platform-dependent.

hmAgentRouterVrrpAdminState.name: hmAgentRouterVrrpAdminState
hmAgentRouterVrrpAdminState.description: Sets the administrative mode of VRRP in the router.

hmVrrpTrackingTable.name: hmVrrpTrackingTable
hmVrrpTrackingTable.description: This table contains variables to define an entry in the VRRP Tracking database.

hmVrrpTrackIfIndex.name: hmVrrpTrackIfIndex
hmVrrpTrackIfIndex.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The interface number of the virtual router

hmVrrpTrackVrid.name: hmVrrpTrackVrid
hmVrrpTrackVrid.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The virtual router id for this virtual router

hmVrrpTrackId.name: hmVrrpTrackId
hmVrrpTrackId.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The id of the object being tracked

hmVrrpTrackDecrement.name: hmVrrpTrackDecrement
hmVrrpTrackDecrement.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The value by wich the current priority of the virtual router is decremented when the tracked object goes DOWN.

hmVrrpTrackOperStatus.name: hmVrrpTrackOperStatus
hmVrrpTrackOperStatus.description: Shows if the tracked object is currently UP od DOWN

hmVrrpTrackRowStatus.name: hmVrrpTrackRowStatus
hmVrrpTrackRowStatus.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } Defines the status of a vrrp tracking database entry. Set to createAndGo(4) to create a new row. Set to destroy(6) to delete an entry. Reads as active(1) if the tracked object exists and is trackable, notReady(3) otherwise.

hmVrrpExtTable.name: hmVrrpExtTable
hmVrrpExtTable.description: This table contains variables to define an entry in the VRRP enhancements database.

hmVrrpExtIfIndex.name: hmVrrpExtIfIndex
hmVrrpExtIfIndex.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The interface number of the virtual router

hmVrrpExtVrid.name: hmVrrpExtVrid
hmVrrpExtVrid.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The virtual router id for this virtual router

hmVrrpExtDomainId.name: hmVrrpExtDomainId
hmVrrpExtDomainId.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The domain this virtual router is a member of. If set to 0, the virtual router is not a member of any domain.

hmVrrpExtDomainRole.name: hmVrrpExtDomainRole
hmVrrpExtDomainRole.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The role of this virtual router in its domain. This is none(1) if the virtual router is not member of a domain, supervisor(3) if it is the supervisor of its domain, member(2) otherwise.

hmVrrpExtDomainStatus.name: hmVrrpExtDomainStatus
hmVrrpExtDomainStatus.description: Shows if the domain configuration is correct for this virtual router

hmVrrpExtAdvertAddress.name: hmVrrpExtAdvertAddress
hmVrrpExtAdvertAddress.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The IP address advertisements of the virtual router are sent to

hmVrrpExtAdvertTimer.name: hmVrrpExtAdvertTimer
hmVrrpExtAdvertTimer.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } This is used to set the interval between advertisements in milliseconds. This accesses the same value as vrrpOperAdvertisementInterval.

hmVrrpExtOperPriority.name: hmVrrpExtOperPriority
hmVrrpExtOperPriority.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The current operating priority of the virtual router. This can be different from the configured priority if tracked objects are down. For domain members this is the priority of the supervisor of that Domain.

hmVrrpExtNotifyAddress.name: hmVrrpExtNotifyAddress
hmVrrpExtNotifyAddress.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The IP address notifications of the virtual router are sent to

hmVrrpExtNotifyLinkdown.name: hmVrrpExtNotifyLinkdown
hmVrrpExtNotifyLinkdown.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } Enables or disables sending of notification messages if the virtual router's interface goes down.

hmVrrpExtPreemptionDelay.name: hmVrrpExtPreemptionDelay
hmVrrpExtPreemptionDelay.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } Time (in seconds) after startup of the virtual router by which the preemption of a Master with a lower priority is delayed.

hmVrrpDomainTable.name: hmVrrpDomainTable
hmVrrpDomainTable.description: This table contains variables to define an entry in the VRRP domain database.

hmVrrpDomainMemberSendAdv.name: hmVrrpDomainMemberSendAdv
hmVrrpDomainMemberSendAdv.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } Determines if the members of this domain send advertisement packets. If set to disabled(2), only the supervisor of the domain sends packets.

hmVrrpDomainStatus.name: hmVrrpDomainStatus
hmVrrpDomainStatus.description: Shows if the configuration of the domain is complete.

hmVrrpDomainSupervisorIfIndex.name: hmVrrpDomainSupervisorIfIndex
hmVrrpDomainSupervisorIfIndex.description: The interface number of the supervisor of the domain

hmVrrpDomainSupervisorVrid.name: hmVrrpDomainSupervisorVrid
hmVrrpDomainSupervisorVrid.description: The virtual router id of the supervisor of the domain

hmVrrpDomainOperPriority.name: hmVrrpDomainOperPriority
hmVrrpDomainOperPriority.description: The current operating priority of the domain. This can be different from the configured priority if tracked objects are down. For domain members this is the priority of the supervisor of that Domain if the supervisor is configured and up.

hmVrrpDomainSupervisorOperState.name: hmVrrpDomainSupervisorOperState
hmVrrpDomainSupervisorOperState.description: Shows the current operational state of the domain supervisor.
